website_summaries.verdict: Similar priced units afford more comfort and support for the hands and wrists.
pros: A protective paint coating ensures longevity
cons: Has a distinctive chemical odor at first

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: First kettlebell ever. Was skeptical considering all the negative reviews. Ordered the the 30lb (as pictured), because of the great price! The one I received was packaged in a small box with styrofoam. The KB does have a flat/stable base, with a sticker that reads “Made in China”. I can comfortably grip the handle with both hands. It is smooth throughout and I did not have any issues with any odor. All in all, I am happy with this purchase- I will definitely update later if I run into any issues :)
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Ha anybody else received these broken?
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 of these and 1 arrived with the handle broken. Has this happened to anyone else or just a freak accident? I am worried about flinging these around now in case the other one breaks too and flies through a wall or something.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased and would recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I am really really, happy with these kettlebells! They're cheaper than the Gold's Gym ones at Walmart and the paint doesn't flake off like the others (at least it hasn't yet). I have the 15 and the 20 pounders so far and I expect I'll order more in the future. I searched all over the place for reasonably priced KBs that don't have the CA Prop 65 cancer warning, and it was hard to find one! This one doesn't have the warning, so I'm hoping that means it doesn't have toxic chemicals. Very pleased with these!
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Unusable, can't return
customer_reviews.text: I received an 80 lb kettlebell with a wiggle in the handle which means it is not usable or safe. It also looks like it was welded to the Bell itself which means it's not a true cast iron piece but for the life of me I don't know why you would weld cast iron if it is. Anyway, it is defective and unusable. On top of it I can't return it because the return shipping is more than the kettlebell is worth! Emailed customer service Thursday late afternoon, still haven't heard back and today is Thursday, 1/23/20... Stuck with a hunk of junk... Thanks
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Kettlebells son.
customer_reviews.text: It's a ball of metal with a handle. Hard to mess up. And they didn't. 5 more words required for this review. Cookie, grass, chicken, couch, window.
customer_reviews.author: clark3783

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of equipment, beware slippery grip
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid kettlebell, and the price was pretty great (especially the shipping price). This is great for exercise, and it really takes things up a notch (from a 50 lb bell). One thing that gets me is the finish on the kettlebell, as it makes the grip quite slippery after a few minutes of swings. Overall it is a solid piece of equipment, and if used well is definitely worth its weight.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Great quality kettlebell
customer_reviews.text: I've bought multiple kettlebells on amazon, and have not been let down. Usually issues with kettlebells are the handle size or material that can be damaged, and neither of these are problems. The handle is wide for 1-2 hand movements, and the entire thing is solid cast iron so no worries there. With all weights shipping is usually what drives up the cost, but that wasn't the case here.
customer_reviews.author: Botero

customer_reviews.title: this is tiny but good quality
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our little boy to exercise with us. Please note this thing is very light. The handle is actually big enough for an adult hand (or two kid hands for kettle bell swings). It's a real kettlebell and of good quality, it's just tiny. If that's what you're looking for, I recommend it. Adults will usually want kettlebells in the 20-35lbs range. In addition to use by a child, I could see this being used by an adult for physical therapy or as a nice gift paperweight/decoration for a fitness nut that loves kettlebells.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Kirton

customer_reviews.title: Puts hair on your chest
customer_reviews.text: I'm no kettlebell expert, but I use mine a LOT and it's perfect. It was the cheapest 50 pounder I could find on the internet, and I leave mine outside with the rest of my weights (something feels so manly about working out outside no matter what sort of weather Mother Nature throws at you). I live on the Gulf coast and not a speck of rust after a year. It looks from the pictures that the 55-pound and up change shapes from the 50 and below, which is why I went with 50. It's great. I'm getting strong as Samson with this thing. Can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Odog17

customer_reviews.title: Best value kettlebell!
customer_reviews.text: This 50 pound kettlebell is within .2 pounds of its advertised weight which is perfectly fine by me. It has a very nice to hold handle, it isn't lopsided/uneven on any side, the texture is very smooth all around, and the color is very nice. This feels rock solid, pun intended, and a fantastic value. Edit: After a couple weeks of use, I've noticed that the black coloring of the kettle bell is starting to wear off all over the place. If you're unfortunate, then it will stain whatever it rubbed off onto but it can be cleaned off with little effort. Dropping this review to 4/5 stars for this as the value is still fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Cody C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Value, Not Great Paint Job (see below)
customer_reviews.text: This is my third kettlebell from Yes4All. I mention that because this is the first of the three I've received where I was less than impressed with the paint job. My other two are a 25lb and a 40lb. Maybe because the 60 is so much larger it just was prone to more damage as it was shipped to me? The small chips and scuffs are not a huge problem for me. I purchased the kettlebell for its use, not necessarily its appearance. However, under the handle on the part where your fingers grip the most, there is a paint chip or iron chunk or some kind of defect that is somewhat sharp and annoying to the grip.
customer_reviews.author: Bin

customer_reviews.title: Basic, well-made, cast iron kettlebell.
customer_reviews.text: Top notch kettlebell. I use this on a concrete floor, and sometimes on my blacktop driveway, and it’s still in great shape. Don’t buy this if you prefer having a coated handle - this one is cast iron, and cast iron only. I did quite a bit of ‘shopping around’ when looking for this, searching for a good price-per-pound, and this was a solid cast iron one that beat out most of them. I’ll keep Yes4All in mind when I need more!
customer_reviews.author: Ro Bot

customer_reviews.title: Iron has been scrapped off~
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is amazing! The handles are wider so it’s easier for both your hands to grasp the handle. The only problem that I had with it is that some of the iron looked like it’s been scrapped off. Theres 2 decent sized scraps on each side but I’m sure it was just this one out of the bunch that ended up like this. Other than that I’d reccomend purchasing this product!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: More cheap than inexpensive, might be good enough for you
customer_reviews.text: Depending on what you intend to do, and how heavy of a bell you get, this might be all you need. But, it's cheap. The underside of the handle is a little rough and the texture of the coating leaves a lot to be desired. It's very slick. Comared to a quality bell, well, there is no comparison. But if you're just messing around with a 10 lb bell once in a while casually or as a short fad, sure, it's a lot cheaper than the good bells and it has the right proportions/handle shape.
customer_reviews.author: N. F. C..

customer_reviews.title: I'd buy it again, and again, and again
customer_reviews.text: So I ordered this may 19, and received it next day may 20. The bell was packaged very nicely. A box within a box surrounded by styrofoam. Very pleased with the product itself. Handle is very wide, and feels solid. Bottom is flat no issues there. Sticker on bottom states "made in China". Overall very happy. On a side note the same day before I purchased this is I was at a big box sporting goods store and they wanted 80 dollars for the same exact thing. Got this delivered to my door for under 43 bucks. I walked outta the store laughing. Insane.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: For a while, all I had in my home gym was a set of adjustable-weight dumbells. When I finally decided to add a kettlebell to my set-up, this was the one I settled on. I got the 40-lb model and I'm quite happy with it. The base is flat so it stands nice and firmly on the floor. The handle's design fits well whether I use it with one hand or two. There's not a lot to review, but everything's exactly as was described and it fits my hands well, so I'm quite happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Lewis

customer_reviews.title: quality
customer_reviews.text: Baked enamel finish that holds up. Best value I've seen. If you are NOT looking for something pretty and unique but a solid piece of equipment, this is for you. I believe the Kettlebell "swing" is the best fitness exercise there is. Once you learn how to do it correctly [it's tricky]. you cannot beat it a complete body exercise.
customer_reviews.author: PappyLove

customer_reviews.title: Kettle Bell for Women
customer_reviews.text: This is a great kettle bell! Well-machined with no chips or sharp edges. Nice, thick handle with some texture to it for a good grip. I am a tiny but active woman, and I tried a 15lb bell first. That wasn't heavy enough, so now I'm using a 20lb. I would recommend 20lbs as a good starting weight for women who are beginners with kettle bell but in good shape. 15lbs might be better if you're a beginner in fitness altogether.
customer_reviews.author: Lyndi Suydam

customer_reviews.title: Chipped to death; broke handle
customer_reviews.text: Not only was It was all chipped up, but the Handle is loose too, horrible. I am Very upset. These things are expensive, and I waited over a week for it to get here, only to find it’s broke and unusable.
customer_reviews.author: AMANHASNONAME

customer_reviews.title: Great bell
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my needs. It's not the official 24kg that Pavel recommends; it's a couple pounds shy to be 50 even instead. Hope he doesn't read this and set me straight. Great condition, super fast shipping, fits my hands for single and double hand swings. Still working on using for the getup, but soon.
customer_reviews.author: MrNomer

customer_reviews.title: Got this for my 9 year old
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 9 year old son so he can work out with me in the morning. He tried a 10lb and it was a rough but the 5lb was perfect for him. The Kettlebell is smooth and he enjoys using it.
customer_reviews.author: Larry B

customer_reviews.title: We have three
customer_reviews.text: We have three. They’re Outside in a garage that we half converted to a gym. They’re holding up great and ... well they’re a kettlebell. Exactly what we were looking for. If you don’t have great grip strength, I would say be aware that there is nothing to grip onto.
customer_reviews.author: kodi_ko3

customer_reviews.title: Make these ten times better with gaffer tape
customer_reviews.text: Can’t go wrong with these - simple and heavy. The handle can get a little slippery but you can make it so much better by wrapping with gaffer tape. More confidence when swinging, easier to grip = better workout. Add tape to the bottom to stop your floor getting scratched too!
customer_reviews.author: Roo Williams

customer_reviews.title: Nice wide grip on the 60lb KB.
customer_reviews.text: The enamel on the 60 pound KB is nice and smooth. The grip is extremely wide enough that I can use both hands without any pressure or squeezing of the hands together. The bottom isn't quite as flat because there's some excess material but it's not a deal breaker because I mainly want to use it for KB swings.
customer_reviews.author: PHawk

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous Kettlebell
customer_reviews.text: I received a defective KB, the bottom is uneven. Scratched up. It stands or leans to 1 side when set on floor. It is not balanced or squared properly, which could compromise the exercises and be dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Moreno Webster

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Home Workouts
customer_reviews.text: Perfectly suited for the Kettlebell swings my husband does for home workouts when he's short on time and can't make it to the gym. He wisely does them outside to prevent accidental house destruction or pet death since we have small dogs and they tend to get in the way at inopportune moments. I only use the kettlebell to do squats since there's no way I could swing this thing, but I'm thinking about ordering the 30 lbs one for myself so I can do workouts at home too. I have a small house and no space for other workout equipment so these are perfect for the basic workout!
customer_reviews.author: AnCreek

customer_reviews.title: Nifty little kettlebell
customer_reviews.text: I'll admit, I haven't weighed it on a precision scientific scale, but it's lighter than my 25# kettlebell. It doesn't have any manufacturing imperfections that are cutting my finger or anything like that. I can toss it between hands and do a one-handed swing. The handle is a little small to do anything with two hands, but that's not what I use this for.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Hillington

customer_reviews.title: A good quality cast iron kettlebell. Powder coating is average.
customer_reviews.text: This kettlebell is easy to use, but the powder coating is not that durable. I’ve been using this for about 1 year and some of the paint has chipped off and started to cause minor rust. The smaller kettlebells can be better balanced because they can tip over easily.
customer_reviews.author: JKN

customer_reviews.title: Kettlebell came damaged
customer_reviews.text: Kettlebell came damaged. The 1st time I tried to swing it I noticed that something was loose on the inside of it. I’m concerned that if it broke while using it could cause bodily harm!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Devine

customer_reviews.title: Texture/finish does not match description.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to match my other kettlebells from this brand. It works, but I’m disappointed that the one I received is more matte and does not have a shine indicated in the picture. It does not match my other kettlebells from this brand.
customer_reviews.author: VC2343

customer_reviews.title: No flaws I've yet found
customer_reviews.text: This does what a kettlebell ought to do: get you stronger while making you hate life. All jokes aside, there are no burrs or sharp edges anywhere and, according to my scale, it weighs exactly 65.0 lbs. What more could you want?
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Fahy

customer_reviews.title: You cannot beat that price!
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect! I love them. I FEEL THE BURN! But in all seriousness, they are easy to hold, maneuvering in any workout is simple, and they are very versatile. You cannot beat that price! These weights are usually 40 bucks at walmart or target.
customer_reviews.author: Kyah Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Just bought a 20 as I am new to Kettlebell training. Its a great weight. Im glad I bought it. Ill be getting another 20lbrs. I know that might be to bodybuilding like for hard core KB people. I dont give a ...... ;ll probably also grab a 40lbr. No, Im not looking to beat Jim Cash for strength. Nor turn into Pavel.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great handle, no plastic coating so it allows great grip and ease of use.
customer_reviews.text: I was hasty and ordered a 5 and 10 lb kettlebell to start my new work out routine. I bought the 5lb Solid Cast Iron, and I love, love, love it. Unfortunately they did not have the 10lb, so I had to order a different brand (CAP), and I'm so very disappointed. I love the 5lb weight shape. The handle is great. It's just as you see it, gives great grip and ease of use. The other one has that plastic coating all over it, the handle is not as wide, and it's super uncomfortable to use. I really like this design...I'd recommend.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonUser123

customer_reviews.title: Ow, my face
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction, much like all kettlebells. It's a piece of metal. I ordered two sets - the 45s and 35s. Problem is, one from each set doesn't have a perfectly flat bottom. So tricep dips, push-ups, and anything else that requires body weight on top of kettlebell can be pretty difficult. Not really a fan of falling on my face, but it's happened on more than once occasion. Maybe that's the point? Hadn't thought about toughening my brow, nose and lips. Maybe this is a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: Tim S.

customer_reviews.title: Good economy kellebell.
customer_reviews.text: I can certainly work up a sweat with it. Some people don't like the finish or the shape but the handle is nicely shaped and the slightly irregular surface finish give good grip. My hands are 7.5 inches from wrist to tip of my middle finger and I find the handle diameter perfect. All sharp edges have been smoothed out. When it arrived it felt a little greasy and had a smell from the paint. I thought I'd have to wash it before use but after 24 hours it had dried out, neither smelly or slippery. I also enjoy how it looks like a soviet manly-man's kettlebell instead of a purple vinyl purse.
customer_reviews.author: T. Satterthwait

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: Been waiting for this for a long time, and has been the perfect addition to my workout
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent weight
customer_reviews.text: There isn't much to say about a large chunk of iron... Performs only as good as you can swing or lift it and it's doing pretty well so far. I have large hands and the grip fits me well, could be a little bit larger but overall it's fine
customer_reviews.author: runngun

customer_reviews.title: So-so. Good for beginners, Rec. better quality.
customer_reviews.text: Great starter kettlebell to get used to swings and any carried exercises. Be careful for floor exercises, especially renegade rows. Company claims to machine bottoms for a flat finish, but none of my 4 purchases have been perfectly flat and one is bad enough I won’t use it to prevent another injury.
customer_reviews.author: PNWSurvivalist

customer_reviews.title: A great addition to a workout!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a 40-pounder, and its a great part of my workouts. Not too heavy to swing around...just make sure your grip is strong! And walking around with it in your hands is very effective on forearm muscles.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Miller

customer_reviews.title: 10 pounds too heavey
customer_reviews.text: I got this to do exercises for arms and stomach area. It is too heavy for women I got 10 pounds I should of gotten 5 pounds. I pulled my neck and back out had to go to therapy. Make note start small and work your way up to the weight that works.
customer_reviews.author: Tonda J. Saul

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: This 15lb kettlebell is perfect. It’s easy to hold and to maneuver. It adds a nice amount of resistance to my workouts. I really like it and would absolutely recommend it to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: its2

customer_reviews.title: 4th one from the same company and never disappointed
customer_reviews.text: There's a reason I keep ordering my KBs from the same company and will continue to do so. The price is great, and the quality is consistently good. the black lacquer looks nice and shiny, and there is no warning about prop 65, which makes me happy.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: My first kettlebell
customer_reviews.text: Towards the end of last year I became interested in learning to use kettlebells, but I have very very little arm or upper body strength. I started with this 5-lb. bell from Yes4All, and it was a perfect beginning bell. After using this for a month I moved on to a larger bell. I'd recommend these Yes4All solid cast iron kettlebells, as they are easy to use and handle.
customer_reviews.author: reviewsbyerin

customer_reviews.title: both are fine. Either the products are inconsistent or they sent ...
customer_reviews.text: Interestingly, I bought two of the same style kettlebell--either black or classic black--and one was enamel coated and the other seemed to coated in a rougher, truckbed liner material. Regardless, both are fine. Either the products are inconsistent or they sent me the wrong style. They work though--just the right width, seams are fine, bottom is flat. If you find these for about $1/lb, buy them quickly. I frequently check back on these and notice that the price fluctuates quite a bit. These are darn good quality for the price at ~$1/lb.
customer_reviews.author: David Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality KB
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality KB. Amazing price compared to competition. I bought 20, 25, 30 and 35Lbs from Yes4All. Bought the 30 and 35 Lbs recently, they have a nice shiner coating then the 20 and 25 Lbs I bought last year. But to be fair the first ones were totally fine. You do not have a smelly cast iron you can sometimes find on KB (which leave a very bad smell on your hands). Good quality! I actually need to buy 40Lbs soon and I will buy from this seller again...at 500KB swings a day, progress is fast :-)
customer_reviews.author: Val M

customer_reviews.title: On time and good weight - Rough handle
customer_reviews.text: Solid design, delivered on time and at a good price when others are hard to find. Not the best finish or texture in comparison to others I own. In the end this will definitely get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: pope

customer_reviews.title: Digs into arm when doing single handed exercises.
customer_reviews.text: It weighs 15lbs, what more could you ask for in a bell? Well, apparently a lot. I didn't know. But this kettle bell has taught me that. The flat spot on each side is too big and the edge dug into wrist when I did single handed exercises. It was painful and exercising is painful enough. I didn't care much for the texture either. Our other bell is really smooth. I suppose some people might like a little texture for grip, but not me. Overall, it may work for you, but it did not work for me. Ended up sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: james fairfield

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a Gym Side-Kick.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two five-pounders for my 6-year-old mini me. I got 40lb for swings and had to get these so he can swing 'em like dad.
customer_reviews.author: Charles D

customer_reviews.title: I am working out a home a lot more lately
customer_reviews.text: This kettlebell arrived well packed, and quickly. Simple, high quality and well priced! Very pleased and would buy more weights in this same product if they were available! :)
customer_reviews.author: buddy's mom

customer_reviews.title: Best Handles
customer_reviews.text: I have slightly smaller hands than the average guy and even then most kettlebell handles are to small, okay but unsteady for single arm swings and scrunched up/uncomfortable for double arm swings. The Yes4all handles are awesome. Wide and thicker allowing it to be gripped well. They may seem a little large to a lot of people but they are way safer and if you are average size or up I guarantee they are better than other kettlebells.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Bell

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Great value especially considering how high the costs of kettlebells and other gym equipment have gotten during the pandemic. My kettlebells arrived on time and had no damage. Im very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Darling

customer_reviews.title: Competitive price for KBs
customer_reviews.text: Well, it's a solid piece of cast iron. I'm not sure if you can mess that up, but I will say that it is holding up just fine. Nothing is chipping or flaking. I like the shape of the handle. I don't know why you would pay more money unless you need some type of special competition bell, or need killograms vs. pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Kettlebell Swings anyone???!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Yes4All Solid Cast Iron Kettlebell Weights Set...by Yes4All came in good condition and I did a few Kettlebell Swings and started sweating! This is definitely going to be good to have in my Weight Loss station!
customer_reviews.author: Diamond EverettTop Contributor: Sewing

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and Manufactured Well!
customer_reviews.text: I have the 25lb one and it does the trick for me. There aren't any sharp parts on the handle. It has great construction and I am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: BuddhaGirl

customer_reviews.title: This is quite a fun piece of equipment for the fitness enthusiast
customer_reviews.text: This is quite a fun piece of equipment for the fitness enthusiast. As for this specific Kettlebell, I was quite happy to find the product was exactly the same as pictured, and furthermore the shipping was quite fast! (I ordered it Sunday night and received it Tuesday morning). I would definitely recommend to anyone, however, if you are new to handling Kettlebells or weights in general, you should probably go a little bit lighter in weight.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Best Value in Kettlebells
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, why would you buy anything else. I find the Kettlebells with the fancy finish slip out of your hand. Plus, they cost a lot more. The cast iron is much easier to grip. These kettlebells are much cheaper than what I could find at Sports Authority. The only problem is that the post has trouble with the heavy weight. I try to work in Kettlebell swings and goblet squats each week. There is more that you can do if you like. Kettlebells are great for core conditioning. Just find the right weight for you.
customer_reviews.author: M. F. Koeppen

customer_reviews.title: I love it but I figured out that I need a ...
customer_reviews.text: I love it but I figured out that I need a bell with a thinner handle so I will be getting a different one. The weight is perfect but I have tiny hands for a woman.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: It's Solid. It's Iron. It's a Kettlebell!
customer_reviews.text: It's Solid. It's Iron. It's a Kettlebell! I got a few Kettlebells for a new workout routine at home. It's nice and solid and shiny. It's what it's supposed to be. If you know how to use a Kettlebell, it'll whip you into shape REALLY fast. They're great.
customer_reviews.author: Some Guy

customer_reviews.title: Terrible!
customer_reviews.text: I am so sad that I am already having to list these for sale because they chipped after the first few times using them. The chipped paint has chewed up my arm when I do cleans and has also snagged many of my Lulu Lemon leggings. I do not recommend this product. I'd stick with the powder coated ones, if I were you. Also, the enamel is super duper slippery when your hands are sweaty. It inhibits my full effort in my workouts for fear that I am going to drop them when sweating.
customer_reviews.author: Melin

customer_reviews.title: Got exactly what I ordered and liked it
customer_reviews.text: It’s just a tiny little 5lb thing, but great for shoulder work. Nothing fancy is needed at that weight so this worked great
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Cannot be beat!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent kettlebell! First, shipping... I cannot believe I ordered it Friday and got it on Tuesday. Thanks. As for the kettlebell itself, could not be happier. I do not have the biggest hands, but they are not small either. I got the 50 pounder and not only is the handle more than wide enough for both of my hands, there is also more than ample clearance between the handle and the top of the kettlebell. Little more than $1/lb with shipping, you cannot beat that. If/when I need another, I will be back here!
customer_reviews.author: Blaine

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Good handle. I can hold one with both hands if I want but I’m 5’2”. Had the best price. Nicely made, no sharp or rough edges or seams.
customer_reviews.author: Sam I am

customer_reviews.title: Great material, easy to work with
customer_reviews.text: I love kettlebells, and this one is great. The grip is perfect, there's no slip, and it's just the perfect size for doing exercises, not worried if I might hit myself in the face or if I squat too low and hit the ground haha. :) I would buy this again!!
customer_reviews.author: BriBri

customer_reviews.title: Faulty bell?
customer_reviews.text: I like the finish and it’s a nice size for petite women. But on the handle itself there’s these rough bumps from the finish, and it hurts & can cut your hands if not careful. I have to use gloves to avoid that, so that sucks but good price. I probably just got a bad one and unlucky that those little bumps ended up there of all places.
customer_reviews.author: kcmos

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: The handle broke off. I have used many different brands of kettlebell, I've never had a handle break off before.
customer_reviews.author: garrett m fergus

customer_reviews.title: Good workout for the mailman
customer_reviews.text: I only ordered this for the mailman, who needed the workout after putting on a few pounds at Christmas. I may return it as the UPS guy could do with the workout too. Maybe I'll work up to a heavier one for them both. They'll thank me for it eventually. I'd give it a five if it had Bluetooth - why, I don't know. But it just should, you know.
customer_reviews.author: Scribomatic6000

customer_reviews.title: Great value kettle bell
customer_reviews.text: I think these are great for the money. If you have small hands, or are advanced with bells the handles size and irregularities may bother you.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Van Loan

customer_reviews.title: I love this Kettle Bell!
customer_reviews.text: I love this! I have Kettle Bells from three different companies and this one is by far my favorite. It is small with a large handle that is easy to grip. It is just slightly smaller than my 10lb Kettle Bell, and next to my 20lb kettle bell, it looks like a toy. It is less than 1/2 the size! I picked each one for price, but I wish all of them were made like this one, they would be so much easier to use and to store.
customer_reviews.author: C Timmons

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase I've made this year
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research on how to lift the kettlebell safely, and watched a lot of videos- I suggest you do the same. An expert said a woman should begin with an 18lb KB so I purchased this one. I am having so much fun working out this way which is such a pleasant surprise.
customer_reviews.author: Emoji

customer_reviews.title: This is a great kettlebell for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This was the best deal I could find on a 45lb bell, this works just as good as the ones that cost $80. Decent paint finish, handle is the appropriate size and thickness for a kettlebell of this weight. Just be sure to offer your postal carrier a water or something when they deliver it!
customer_reviews.author: Brad Allen

customer_reviews.title: 35 pounds of joy
customer_reviews.text: Yikes! This is heavy. Like 35 pounds heavy. Just what I ordered. I like that the handle is thick and easy to grab. Other than that, it's a kettlebell, right?
customer_reviews.author: Charles Darwin

customer_reviews.title: I have to say I am very happy with the product and how versatile it can be ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I have ever used Kettle Bells. I have to say I am very happy with the product and how versatile it can be used in working out. It works on every muscle and does just isolate certain muscles as with dumb bells. By far te best piece of exercise equipment I have ever bought.
customer_reviews.author: cmkushne

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Well-made 15 lb kettle bell. Very durable and handle fits nicely in hand. Price was very affordable and cheap. Arrived sooner than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Eliza

customer_reviews.title: What I Wanted.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a set of these kettlebells (5,10 &15lbs). I have no doubt these will last for a lifetime. The handle is fairly smooth and is just the right width for a tight, comfortable grasp. The bottom is nice and flat so the bell does not move or wobble at all. ***UPDATE*** 7/9/15*** I have since added a 20lb bell and more recently a 35lb one. Just as before, perfect condition and flat bottoms. I can use both the 20&35 lb bells comfortably with both hands.
customer_reviews.author: Nette

customer_reviews.title: Paint Chipping after a Month Use
customer_reviews.text: I have several of this brand of kettlebells but this particular bell's coating is flaking off on the front and back, where the number and name are printed. It would never have had any impact there, so it just seems defective.
customer_reviews.author: sam

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job Pefectly
customer_reviews.text: I bought two 30 lb. kettlbells. I ordered on Tuesday morning and they arrived on Thursday via USPS. These kettlebells are just perfect. they are level enough to do the renegade rows with no problem. unlike the CAP Kettlebells, the paint job on these cannot be chipped. those seem to have some kind of enamel so they look shiny. The handle is just fine on the 30 lbs. - a little thinner than the heavier ones. No problems for the hands - no scraping. They absolutely do the job. the workout I can get from these two kettlebells is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Eric B

customer_reviews.title: Black iron, just the way I wanted, and inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to kettlebells. I overanalyze everything. I looked at a bunch of OTHER options and saw people complaining about scratches on the gloss finish or painted bells and that would bug me. Especially as they get used. This is a jet black piece of iron, that makes me feel like I WANT to work out with it. No glitz, all business. I feel stronger just looking at the thing ;). I got it faster than expected. There was about a 2 week delivery time estimated. I got it in under a week.
customer_reviews.author: smf

customer_reviews.title: Bought this kettlebell because it was such a good deal. The kettlebell gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Bought this kettlebell because it was such a good deal. The kettlebell gets the job done, the only downside to this KB is that the bottom surface is not truly flat so it wiggles if you're trying to do push ups with them. Other than that its a solid KB and is a good option if you're on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio Villasenor

customer_reviews.title: Handle Shape & Thickness Undesirable
customer_reviews.text: I like the weight itself, however, I do not like the way the handle is shaped and the thickness of the handle makes it hard to hold onto especially with the glossy finish.
customer_reviews.author: jmcgouldrick

customer_reviews.title: Best buy
customer_reviews.text: It's a hunk of metal with a handle. Hard to get that wrong. This is just as good as any other kettlebell (handle and ball one solid piece) and for a better price. No reason NOT to get it.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Anne Martin

customer_reviews.title: It suits me perfectly well and is shaped like my other weights
customer_reviews.text: I've been slowly working up my weight progression since incorporating kettle weights into my exercise routine. This model is a fairly priced, no frills kettlebell. Based on my home scale it is indeed 20 lbs, the finish is a plain black paint, there are no rough spots or chips, It suits me perfectly well and is shaped like my other weights, I look forward to using it often.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I don't like this company's kettlebells. Ease of use is below average. The feel is clunky and it has an uncomfortable grip. I regret buying it considering how much these things in general cost.
customer_reviews.author: pjrd

customer_reviews.title: Great quality not Slippery
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a workout using a kettle bell! not slippery at all, if it is you are not holding them right. its honestly a great product dropped it a few times and it hold up. definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Abel Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Quality and Excellent Price.
customer_reviews.text: Great kettlebell for workout. Easy to use. Came fairly fast. Great Seller.
customer_reviews.author: Sara E N Texas

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: I have this 10 pounder for single-arm moves. Great for the around the head and around the body exercises!
customer_reviews.author: Cre8

customer_reviews.title: Thank You!!
customer_reviews.text: I love these kettles! As described, quick service and I recommend this seller.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gains?  Not yet.  Hopefully soon after I get off the couch...
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as advertised. As someone just getting started working out again after years off I realize I should have also gotten a smaller weight as this one is too heavy for some stuff.
customer_reviews.author: PrincessGingerSnapp

customer_reviews.title: As Described
customer_reviews.text: Very cute. A real, solid KB. If you want it for a kid or decor, it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Is exactly what it says it is
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was great and I think it actually arrived ahead of schedule. I live in Alaska, so that almost never happens. The Kettlebell itself has been used every day and always performs as expected. It never complains and neither does the husband who uses it :)
customer_reviews.author: catherine smith

customer_reviews.title: Amazing products as at an amazing value !
customer_reviews.text: I love it , the quality isn’t cheap it’s outstanding and is noticeably durable , don’t let the price fool you , I would definitely buy more weights from this same seller !
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Pay a buck a pound for iron from China.
customer_reviews.text: Self explanatory, but the paint job is pretty bad - one spot had a sideways dried flake that I immidiatly sliced my finger on. A few hits with a file took care of it. The bottom of the bell is doused with paint but who cares.
customer_reviews.author: randen

customer_reviews.title: has good finish and gives a great workout
customer_reviews.text: product was delivered very quickly, much faster than expected. not to much to say about a 35# cast iron product, but it has good finish and gives a great workout
customer_reviews.author: greekpmd

customer_reviews.title: Durable and made well
customer_reviews.text: Nicely made and I don't have to worry about it falling apart or breaking.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke M. Arrington

customer_reviews.title: A hunk of metal for the mind, back and soul.
customer_reviews.text: It arrived heavy. Which is why I wanted it! Works perfect for my workout. No major construction problems with it so far. Highly recommend if you're into slow and steady back exercises to strengthen your core and reduce risk of spinal column injury. Read the research and work out with it safely!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas W. Thornberry

customer_reviews.title: Very solid
customer_reviews.text: Took way too long to ship but very solid kettle bell for the price.
customer_reviews.author: SoonerGee

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I will be buying more of these. Try doing lunges while holding these. Your legs will hate you, but it burns so good. I can lift heavier, but I took GOOD advice and started out light. After a few weeks, your body gets used to the weight and you can move up. Be patient.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Ellison

customer_reviews.title: Mismatched Kettlebell Finishes
customer_reviews.text: Kettlebells are functionally fine, but I ordered two 10 pounders and one has a gloss finish while the other is matte--see photo. Couldn't even send me a matched set? Now I'm wondering what my two 30 pounders will look like! What a pain. Am I supposed to send one back? Who knows what I'll receive next time? Send me one more--then I'll return whichever is the odd one out.
customer_reviews.author: BXR

customer_reviews.title: Awesome deal
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 40 lb kettle bell for $27.00 (plus shipping), and it arrived quickly and looks great. Solid, seems well-made. The grip is pretty wide, which helps to build grip strength. $27.00 plus about $15.00 shipping is a great deal for a kettle bell; it's just over a dollar per pound, which is hard to beat for plate weights, let alone kettle bells. I will definitely buy from this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: MrEMeat

customer_reviews.title: You know what you're buying.. fully functional, solid weight
customer_reviews.text: I mean it's a one piece, solid kettle bell so you know what you're getting. Also be aware that if you buy this you, like me and the other reviewers, are a jerk that is making the delivery person carry it... which if your workouts go well becomes the delivery person carrying a 35lber in a month but great for working out.
customer_reviews.author: Donn

product_meta.title: Yes4All Solid Cast Iron Kettlebell Weights – Great for Full Body Workout and Strength Training
feature_bullets: 10 LBS HIGH-QUALITY SOLID CAST IRON KETTLEBELL: Built to last - constructed of solid cast iron with no welds, weak spots, or seams. Great for training indoor & outdoor
BLACK PAINT FINISH: Painted to prevent corrosion and increase durability & give you better grip strength with no slipping in your hand like a glossy finish
WIDE, SMOOTH HANDLE: Smooth, slightly textured handle to provide a comfortable & secure grip for high reps, makes chalk unnecessary for both men & women
FLAT BOTTOM FOR STABILITY: Enable upright storage, ideal for renegade rows, handstands, mounted pistol squats & other exercises requiring a kettlebell with a flat bottom

MOST VERSATILE & FUNCTIONAL FITNESS EQUIPMENT: Used for swings, deadlifts, squats, lifting, get-ups & snatches to workout & increase strength of many muscle groups & body parts including biceps, shoulders, legs, & more

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
